title: Exclusive: Ineos’ Americas VP on Sales, Off-Road Culture, and What Comes Next
description: A few weeks ago, we examined — and lamented — the idea that Ineos might be on the way out. With unclear sales figures and recent job cuts miring the brand, there wasn’t a lot of silver lining to find. However, after an exclusive interview with Gregor Hembrough, Executive Vice President of the ...
titleSummary: "Ineos' US Leader Talks Turbulent Markets, Trailblazing Vehicles, and the Road Ahead"
descriptionSummary: In a surprising shift, we revisit the fortunes of Ineos, whose uncertain future had sparked concerns just weeks ago amidst faltering sales and staff reductions. Now, an intimate conversation with one of its top executives offers a glimmer of hope.

title: Ford Is Secretly Offering Discounts on New Cars to Keep Frustrated Owners From Leaving
description: 2025 has been rough for the Blue Oval. After tax incentives fell away, EV sales have been falling, and with quality control issues continuing to plague the automaker, Ford took the unwanted record for the most recalls in a single calendar year - a feat it achieved in just the first six months of ...
titleSummary: "Ford Lures Stray Customers Back with Surprise Savings and Incentives"
descriptionSummary: Ford has faced a tumultuous 2025, marked by declining EV sales following the expiration of tax incentives and ongoing quality control problems. The brand set an unwelcome record, amassing its highest number of recalls to date within just six months.

title: Cadillac is Hard Launching its Most Important New Car at the Super Bowl
description: Over the past few years, Cadillac, General Motors' premier luxury marque, has had quite the tidal shift. In the decades before German imports dominated the U.S. luxury car market, Cadillac was the byword in all-out American luxury, as big boulevard cruising slabs were the vehicular statement pieces ...
titleSummary: Cadillac Rolls Out Its Flagship Vehicle in Prime Time This Sunday
descriptionSummary: Cadillac's reputation for opulence took a dramatic turn with the rise of European luxury brands in recent years. Historically, it stood alone as the pinnacle of American high-end motoring, epitomizing grandeur and power on America's boulevards.

title: Ford Uses 1,000 Bouncy Balls to Show How Brutal Parts Shipping Really Is
description: A major part of automotive manufacturing is parts delivery. In a global manufacturing world, brands must ensure that parts are manufactured and delivered to the multitude of production and assembly facilities worldwide. Given this, it's vital that the parts are delivered safely without any damage, ...
titleSummary: "Ford's Daring Test: How Roughly Handling Packaging Can Damage Your Ride"
descriptionSummary: With a sprawling network of production and assembly sites across the globe, automotive manufacturers face a critical challenge: ensuring timely and secure delivery of essential parts to every facility on time, in perfect condition.

title: A 498,000-Mile Honda S2000 Just Hit a Salvage Auction, and It Still Runs
description: Revered for its high-revving naturally-aspirated engine and telepathic handling, the Honda S2000 is one of the Japanese marque’s last pure driver’s cars from a bygone era, and widely considered a future classic. The red car you see here is listed on an IAA salvage auction with a staggering 498,452 ...
titleSummary: "High-Mileage Honda Survives to Thrill Bidders at Unconventional Auction Sale"
descriptionSummary: This rare Honda S2000 is a quintessential driver's car, renowned for its potent naturally aspirated engine and razor-sharp handling. With just 498,000 miles, it's a prime example of the marque's last true driving machine from a bygone era.

title: BMW Quietly Teases Its Next Electric SUV
description: The first of BMW's Neue Klasse vehicles, the iX3 crossover, has been launched, and now the Bavarian automaker has quietly teased another new arrival. In an Instagram video showing an Advent calendar, first noted by BMW Blog, an animation shows renderings of the i5 sedan, the remarkably ...
titleSummary: BMW Unveils Glimpse of Its Upcoming All-Electric Crossover Model
descriptionSummary: BMW is gearing up for a new model launch, following the introduction of its pioneering iX3 crossover. A subtle teaser on social media hints at the upcoming arrival of the highly anticipated i5 sedan.

title: Toyobaru Fans, Rejoice: The GR86 and BRZ Oil Pressure Problem Finally Has a Real Fix
description: We're pretty sure every Toyota GR86 and Subaru BRZ owner is well aware of the oil pressure issues in their cars. It's also a cautionary tale to any prospective buyers of these cars, whether new or used. Let's be honest, the Toyobaru twins are destined to do laps around the ...
titleSummary: "Oil Pressure Woes of Subaru's Twin Terrors Now Solved at Last"
descriptionSummary: Toyota GR86 and Subaru BRZ owners know all too well about the oil pressure problems plaguing their vehicles. For potential buyers, it's a critical consideration for both new and pre-owned models of these iconic sports cars.

title: This Electric SUV Costs Under $20,000 But You Have to Rent the Battery
description: The automotive industry has spent years trying to crack the code on making electric vehicles more accessible to buyers. While that’s usually meant reducing battery costs or offering government incentives, Malaysian carmaker Perodua has taken a completely different route with its newly launched ...
titleSummary: Affordable Electric Ride Comes with a Catch: Batteries Are Now Optional Rentals
descriptionSummary: The quest for greater electric vehicle accessibility has driven innovation in various forms, from cost reductions to government subsidies. Now, Malaysia's Perodua is pioneering a fresh approach to bridge the gap between EVs and mainstream buyers.

title: Mitsubishi Is Interested in Building Cars Again in America, But It Needs Help
description: Mitsubishi hasn't built a car in the US since the Normal, Illinois plant shut down in 2015. That factory, originally launched as a joint venture with Chrysler in the 1980s, once produced models like the Eclipse and Galant before demand cooled and costs took over. Since then, Mitsubishi has relied ...
titleSummary: Mitsubishi Seeks Partner to Revive US Manufacturing Operations After Years of Absence
descriptionSummary: Mitsubishi's US manufacturing presence ended abruptly when its Normal, Illinois plant ceased operations in 2015, marking the final chapter for a joint venture that had produced popular models like the Eclipse and Galant since the 1980s.

title: Ford Shelby F-250 Super Baja Selling For $70,500 Could Be the Steal of the Year
description: A heavily outfitted 2021 Ford F-250 Shelby Super Baja, one of only 250 produced, sold for $70,500 on Bring a Trailer. descriptionSummary: A highly customized 2021 Ford F-250 Shelby Super Baja, part of an exclusive production run of just 250 vehicles, fetched a surprisingly modest $70,500 on Bring a Trailer, significantly less than its predecessor's staggering sale price.

title: Honda's Sales Are Horrible in November—Except For One SUV
description: American Honda concluded November with a disappointing performance in terms of sales volume. Compared to October, which saw a slight 0.5% month-over-month bump, the results for November show a steep decline: total sales slid to 102,824 units, down 16.8% from the previous month. descriptionSummary: American Honda's sales numbers took a sharp turn in November, plummeting by 16.8% to 102,824 units after a moderate 0.5% increase in October. This decline marked a significant slowdown for the company.

description: Bentley has revealed a new Carbon Fiber Styling Specification for the Continental GT, GT Convertible (GTC), and Flying Spur sedan. descriptionSummary: Bentley is introducing a striking new Carbon Fiber Styling Specification for its Continental GT, GTC, and Flying Spur models. This bold option offers a modern contrast to traditional Bentley luxury trimmings.

title: Toyota's New Luxury Division Won't Follow Jaguar's Pure EV Direction
description: During the 2025 Japan Mobility Show, Toyota not only introduced a bold luxury coupe, but it also launched a new ultra-luxury marque that sits above Lexus. descriptionSummary: At the 2025 Japan Mobility Show, Toyota unveiled an ambitious luxury coupe and announced its new premium marque, Century, which eclipses Lexus in opulence. This ultra-luxury brand may soon dominate Japan's high-end market alongside Rolls-Royce and Bentley.

title: Rimac One-Ups Musk By Revealing a Fleet of Robotaxis Before Tesla Does
description: For years, Tesla has been seen as the frontrunner in autonomous mobility. From Autopilot to self-driving cabs, the company is inching toward a future of driverless ride-sharing through gradual improvements in its driver-assist software. descriptionSummary: Sources familiar with the Trump administration's plans have indicated that new, revised fuel economy standards will be proposed as early as this week, aimed at easing what officials perceive as a significant regulatory hurdle.

title: Mercedes-Benz is Almost Ready to Introduce a New G-Class Cabriolet
description: Following the sharing of a shadowy teaser image in September, heralding the imminent introduction of a new G-Class Cabriolet, Mercedes-Benz has now released clear images of a prototype thereof, with the body still wrapped in camouflage. descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz is gearing up to unveil its latest addition: a convertible version of the iconic G-Class. Following a cryptic teaser in September, the automaker has revealed clear photos of a camouflaged prototype, offering a first glimpse at the forthcoming model.

title: TEASED: Kia May Be Reviving the Stinger as a Sleek All-Electric Sedan
description: The Kia Stinger may be about to make a comeback as an all-electric sedan. The Stinger was foreshadowed by the 2011 GT Concept and the Kia GT4 Stinger Concept before finally entering production in 2017. With a front-engine rear- or all-wheel-drive setup and sharp styling, it drew comparisons to the ...

descriptionSummary: A revival of the Kia Stinger is rumored, this time as an electrified sedan, potentially building on the brand's previous concept cars that first hinted at its arrival nearly a decade ago with the 2011 GT Concept.

title: Downsized, Efficient, But Fragile — Why Today’s Engines May Not Last
description: There’s no escaping the fact that modern engines are failing at alarming rates. Toyota, Honda, and General Motors have all issued massive recalls involving hundreds of thousands of vehicles due to catastrophic engine failures. title: Mazda Defends CX-5’s Giant Touchscreen After Fans Complain
description: Mazda unveiled the all-new CX-5 a few months ago, and one of the major talking points was its new user interface, now dominated by a large touchscreen. The move marked a departure from Mazda's traditional approach, sparking debate among enthusiasts who'd grown accustomed to the automaker's more subtle design ethos.

description: When the new-generation Dodge Charger was announced to be going full-electric, most people, especially fans of the legendary nameplate, were skeptical. Initial reactions were lukewarm, but Dodge has since hinted at reviving traditional options for loyal followers.

title: Stellantis Is Backing Germany’s Call to Ease EU Emissions Rules
description: According to a new report published by Reuters on December 1, the large multinational automaker known as Stellantis is backing the German government's plea to soften the European Union car emissions rules that are set to take effect in about a decade, noting that the German Chancellor's proposal is ...
titleSummary: "Stellantis Throws Its Weight Behind Loosening EU's Stricter Emission Standards"
descriptionSummary: Stellantis, a leading international automaker, has come out in support of Germany's bid to ease EU car emission regulations slated for 2030. The move follows a proposal from the German Chancellor.

descriptionSummary: The final iterations of Alfa Romeo's potent Giulia and Stelvio variants narrowly escaped extinction before being given new life by a sudden change in direction from the brand, which is shifting focus towards electric vehicles.

title: The Idea of a Self-Driving RV Seems To Have Everyone Excited
description: The Tesla Robovan concept was unveiled at the company’s ‘We, Robot’ event in October last year to quite a positive reception. titleSummary: "Road to Autonomy: Electric RVs Steer Toward Revolutionary Road Trips"

description: BMW has been involved since the mid-'30s and became even more active by the mid-'60s. There was also the intention to ...
titleSummary: "High-Stakes Auction for Rare BMW "Batmobile" Set to Soar Past $1 Million Mark"
descriptionSummary: BMW's motorsport ambitions date back to the 1930s, but it wasn't until the 1960s that they intensified their efforts. The formation of the M division in 1972 marked a significant milestone, driven by Bob Lutz's vision for a factory racing team.

description: Among one-off automotive projects, few creations capture the imagination like a Hellcat-powered minivan. titleSummary: "High-Octane Makeover Transforms Humble Minivan into Insanely Powerful Sleeper Van."

title: This $300K Restomod Turns a Mercedes SLK 55 Into a Modern 300SL Gullwing
description: The appeal of old cars typically lies in their design alone, because living with, sourcing parts for, and maintaining a classic is an experience that can be uncomfortable, difficult, and expensive. title: Porsche Resurrects Historic Fabrics Because You Can't Beat the Classics
description: When it comes to the ownership of special and iconic models from brands, upkeep is a major consideration. Owners of said vehicles tend to want to keep their cars as close to original as possible, especially the classics. It's hard enough to maintain old cars, but finding the required parts is even ...
titleSummary: Porsche Revives Timeless Textures for a Modern Twist on Heritage Designs
descriptionSummary: For enthusiasts of rare and vintage vehicles, preservation is paramount. Keeping classic cars in pristine condition requires meticulous care and attention to detail, particularly when sourcing authentic replacement parts can be a significant challenge.

title: 2026 Volkswagen ID.4 Faces Stiffer Competition Even as Prices Stay Flat
description: Volkswagen’s Q3 2025 results show a noticeable uptick for the ID.4, which jumped 176 percent year-over-year with 12,470 units sold. It was one of the few bright spots in VW’s US lineup, which saw overall sales fall 6 percent for the quarter. Beneath the surface, timing likely played a role. The ...
titleSummary: "Flat Pricing Can't Shield VW's Electric SUV from Growing Rivalry"
descriptionSummary: Volkswagen's Q3 2025 results reveal a significant boost for the ID.4, with sales skyrocketing 176% to 12,470 units year-over-year. Amid declining US market share, the ID.4 stands out as a rare bright spot in VW's lineup.

title: Your Next Family SUV Could Also be Your First Home Battery
description: The street is dark, your neighbors’ houses are out, and your kids are still watching Netflix like nothing happened. The difference is sitting in your driveway. Vehicle-to-home charging turns a Kia EV9 or Hyundai Ioniq 9 into a giant backup battery for your house, not just a way to skip gas ...
titleSummary: "Family Vehicles May Double as Power Hubs for Sustainable Homes"

title: Kia Carnival, Sportage, and Seltos Set November Sales Records in America
description: Kia had another bumper sales month in November, with the Korean marque selling 72,002 vehicles in the United States. This is a 3% year-over-year increase and the brand’s best November ever. Kia also says the November result ensures it will achieve its third consecutive all-time annual sales record. ...

descriptionSummary: Kia continues to surge forward with an impressive sales performance in November, delivering 72,002 vehicles in the US - a 3% jump from last year and a new brand record for the month. This strong showing sets up Kia for another all-time high annual sales mark.

If you have never watched the film, it basically depicts the onset of the 2008 financial crisis and how it was triggered by a housing market bubble in the United ...
titleSummary: "Tesla Warning Issued by Renowned Analyst with Dim Outlook for Electric Car Maker"
descriptionSummary: Michael Burry's name has been etched into financial lore due to his prescient warnings about the 2008 crisis, immortalized in the hit film The Big Short. For those familiar with Wall Street, his story is a cautionary tale of foresight and hubris.

descriptionSummary: Luxury car enthusiasts with deep pockets may want to take note of the Purosangue, a rare and highly sought-after vehicle despite its production volume exceeding initial expectations. Demand remains strong for this V12-powered model.

title: Why the BMW E46 Is Still Everyone’s Favorite Modern 3 Series
description: Which BMW 3 Series is the best 3 Series? You'll probably hear the second-generation E30 or the fourth-generation E46 as the top answers. It's totally understandable, though, as those two are often regarded as peak models. The E46 3 Series is a proper classic now. It was introduced on November 11, ...
titleSummary: "The Timeless Charm of the BMW E46: A Modern Classic Reborn"
descriptionSummary: The BMW 3 Series has a rich history, with several generations vying for the top spot. Two standouts are the sleek E30 and the iconic E46, both of which have earned cult followings over time.

title: Ford CEO Jim Farley Asks If You Want An Affordable High-Performance RWD Sedan
description: Sedans have become scarce, particularly from American automakers, and at Ford, they're completely extinct. titleSummary: "Farley Asks: Can Americans Afford a Budget-Friendly Muscle Car?"
descriptionSummary: American sedans have all but vanished from the market, a casualty of the rise of utility vehicles. To make room for its new SUVs and crossovers, Ford's sedan lineup has been phased out, says CEO Jim Farley.

title: Toyota's New Supercar Will Share The Spotlight With A Lexus Twin
description: Only three days ago, Toyota teased its new sports car, which will be named GR GT. Toyota didn't provide any information about the cars, ...
